alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Brooks Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 07 at 2:13PM AKST until January 10 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKST SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Strong winds with blowing snow, low visibility and cold wind chills occuring. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Visibility will be one half mile or less at times. North winds gusting 45 mph. Wind chills to 55 below. * WHERE...In Passes. * WHEN...Until midnight Sunday night. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...North winds gusting to 45 mph in passes are causing blowing and drifting snow with low visibility. Cold wind chills to 55 below zero can cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. Large snow drifts will form. Avalanches will be possible near steep terrain. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for blowing snow means periods of blowing snow will cause travel difficulties. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
